result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Transport for Plea and Sentencing

9:30 AM Defendant Shane H. Ray not in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Shane H. Ray.  Attorney Dennis G Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has attempted to get defendant by zoom with no success for approximately 20 minutes of attempting. Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing today. Defense indicates client is ready to go forward. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
11:50 AM Defendant Shane H. Ray appeared by video, in custody at Department of Corrections - Winnebago.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Shane H. Ray.  Attorney Karl Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appearing via zoom. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
No contact with PP (1948) and JP(1947).
